alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 1:04PM MST until July 12 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR APACHE COUNTY... At 103 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain north of Vernon. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little Ortega Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 61 between mile markers 355 and 367. Highway 60 near mile marker 360 and 361. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oso Draw, Mineral Creek, Concho Creek, Sepulveda Creek and Brown Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
